com.redhat.rhn.common.validator

Interface Constraint

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NumericConstraint, ParsedConstraint, RequiredIfConstraint, StringConstraint

    public interface Constraint

    The Constraint class represents a single data constraint

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ValidatorError checkConstraint(java.lang.Object value)
      Check the field against this Constraint to see if it is in a valid state.
      java.lang.String getDataType()
      This will return the String version of the Java data type for this constraint.
      java.lang.String getIdentifier()
      Get the named identifier of this Constraint
      void setDataType(java.lang.String dataTypeIn)
      This will allow the data type for the constraint to be set.

    • Method Detail

      • checkConstraint

        ValidatorError checkConstraint(java.lang.Object value)
        Check the field against this Constraint to see if it is in a valid state.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to check
        Returns:
        String error message if the constraint check failed. Null otherwise.

      • getIdentifier

        java.lang.String getIdentifier()
        Get the named identifier of this Constraint
        Returns:
        String identifier

      • getDataType

        java.lang.String getDataType()

        This will return the String version of the Java data type for this constraint.

        Returns:
        String - the data type for this constraint.

      • setDataType

        void setDataType(java.lang.String dataTypeIn)

        This will allow the data type for the constraint to be set. The type is specified as a Java String.

        Parameters:
        dataTypeIn - String that is the Java data type for this constraint.
